Hosting the Documentation
=========================

This documentation is built using **Sphinx**. You can host it on any static site provider (GitHub Pages, Netlify, Vercel) or run it locally.

Building Locally
----------------

To generate the HTML files from the source:

1.  **Install Requirements**:

    .. code-block:: bash

        pip install sphinx sphinx_rtd_theme

2.  **Run Build**:

    .. code-block:: bash

        cd docs
        make html

3.  **View**:
    Open ``docs/_build/html/index.html`` in your browser.

Deploying to GitHub Pages
-------------------------

You can automate deployment using GitHub Actions.

1.  Create a workflow file ``.github/workflows/docs.yml``:

    .. code-block:: yaml

        name: Docs
        on: [push]
        jobs:
          build:
            runs-on: ubuntu-latest
            steps:
            - uses: actions/checkout@v2
            - uses: actions/setup-python@v2
            - run: pip install sphinx sphinx_rtd_theme
            - run: cd docs && make html
            - uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
              with:
                github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
                publish_dir: ./docs/_build/html
